Compound 2 was isolated as a white solid from CH 2Cl 2/MeOH mixture. Its molecular formula was deduced as C 7H 8N 6O 5 from the ESI-MS signal at m/z 257.4 [M+H] + and from the HR-LC/MS signal at m/z 279.1603 [M+Na] +, in accordance with seven degrees of unsaturations. Additional data from the ESI-MS spectrum displayed other peaks at m/z 159.4 [M 1+H] + and 181.6 [M 1 + Na] + which are characteristics of allantoin ( 1) [ 44].
